p: First‐year survival was highly correlated with variation in female population growth rates ( r = 0.85) and the 95% CRI excluded zero (Figure 8). Adult survival rate was positively correlated with total female population growth r = 0.46 (95% CRI 0.27, 0.63) (Figure 8). Both the probability of nest success and fecundity were positively correlated with population growth r = 0.32 (95% CRI 0.19, 0.44) though less so than adult or first‐year survival rates.
